page.title: 19The Medway
page.content: In the bottom four squares of our area runs the River Medway.On either side of the river are fields and woodland.In the fields grow wheat, oats,barley,rape and grass.Some of the fields are used as rough grazing land.Bulls and cows are grazing there. People use the river for fishing, canoeing,pleasure cruising and for walking by. In our area there are two locks that have just had their fittings painted green and white.If you are very lucky you might see a boat go through them. A lot of dykes run from the river,and these are crossed by small bridges which have bars across them to stop the cattle getting into the fields of crops.There are a lot of wild flowers and insects by the river.There are also a lot of pill boxes from the war.
